text: Day five in Finland.

This morning we're taking a speed boat from
Kasnas to Hanko.
Ready for some adventure guys?
Yeah!
Yes!

Finland's archipelago region, which is part
of the Baltic Sea, is home to thousands of
small islands.

The rib boat was a fun way to experience the
natural scenery of this area.

Plus it got us to the port town of Hanko in
record time.
Woo!

We just arrived here in Hanko and we've picked
up our Sun Fun bikes and we're going to go
on a little tour of the city.

Hanko is a small town that sits on the shores
of the Baltic Sea, and it also happens to
be the southernmost point in all of Finland.

This is a popular summer destination, where
Finns rent villas by the sea.

Everything about the town felt laid-back and
relaxed.

Our afternoon in Hanko was spent doing a little
bit of hiking and plenty of biking past ponds,
through forests, and along the beach.
So you just made some new friends!
Bah bah!

I'm just hanging out with my new friends here
the sheep.

- some vegetables and different things - and
we're going to be cooking our own meal tonight.

an electric fence and we both just got zapped.
That's an electric fence.

to visit a few local farms and now we're going

to be cooking a meal with all of those local
ingredients.
